com.andresjesse.jpctblend.actors

Class SampleActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.andresjesse.jpctblend.actors.SampleActor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IActor

    public class SampleActor
extends java.lang.Object
implements IActor
    SampÄºe Actor, this class shows how to create a custom Actor. Note that this is the sample "Green Human" used in Blender. You can define an Actor to be whatever you want (3D Objects, Billboards, Shader Based Object, etc). An instance of your class will be positioned exactly in the same point as defined in Blender. You can also define an "Act" behavior, that will be executed at each frame of your gameplay.
    Author:
    andres

      SampleActor()
      Constructor: Here you can define your Actor mesh, texture, props, etc.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      Create here your behavior, act is called at each frame, so you don't need to create a loop here.

      Create here your logic to add your actor to the world.
      void removeFromWorld()
      Create here your logic to remove actor from world.
      void setPosition(com.threed.jpct.SimpleVector pos)
      Set position to your actor (make sure to configure all objects if you have more than one).
      void setRotation(com.threed.jpct.SimpleVector rot)
      Set rotation to your actor (make sure to configure all objects if you have more than one).

      • act

        public void act()
        Create here your behavior, act is called at each frame, so you don't need to create a loop here. More info in the JPCTBlend Manual.
        Specified by:
